result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Leggett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called 4:02pm 
15CF298 - Motion to amend counts 1 & 2 to misd. bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) - granted by court -
16CF156 & 16CF57 DRI - 
Plea no contest to amended counts - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguments by Dunphy/Koppelman/Court to sentencing - Sentence withheld - 24 months probation - Counseling as recommended by agent - CC/SC - No alcohol, no taverns - AODA and follow through with recommended treatment - Supervision fees as determined  by agent - To check in with probation and parole, defendant to contact agent to see if he has to report to the office -  Post conviction rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All three cases called Appearances given.  State informs the court that the an offer has been made and the deft is willing to take the offer.  Pleas and sentencing on the case set for Monday October 31, 2016.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Arraignment on July 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court rules that probable cause exists for bind over.  Arraignment scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
